addons.name: ThunderBirthDay
addons.description: Display birthdays from the Thunderbird addressbooks as events in Lightning.
addons.fullDescription:
+++ Quick install: +++

Install Lightning and ThunderBirthDay, then create a new local calendar choosing ThunderBirthDay as provider.

+++ Problems with Thunderbird 29+: +++

The wizard to create new calendars of Thunderbird 29 and above was broken. The new version 0.8.1 fixes this problem. Everything should work fine again!

+++ Prerequisites: +++

The Lightning extension needs to be installed.

+++ How to use: +++

Create a new calendar in Lightning by clicking File>New>Calendar... in the menu bar. Then choose "On My Computer" as location and "Birthdays from the Thunderbird addressbook" as type for your calendar. Also specify the address book to use as a source for birthdays. Finally choose a name for the new calendar.

Now open the "Edit Card" dialog of an address book card, go to the "Private" tab and set the birthday including the year. Note that these changes don't take effect in the calendar until it gets reloaded. To do this either restart Thunderbird or right click on a calendar from the list, then choose "Reload Remote Calendars".

Also note that the events generated by ThunderBirthDay cannot be modified with Lightning for the moment. Maybe future versions of the extension will be bidirectional.

+++ Any questions? +++

If you have any questions about how to install or use the extension, about technical details, bugs or anything else, please let me know! Suggestions for new features are also very welcome! Just send me a mail to thunderbirthday@(mydomain) replacing (mydomain) by ingomueller.net.

+++ Localizing: +++

If you wish to add a translation for a new language or if you found a mistake in an existing one (including the one in English), I'd be really glad, if you could have a look at the translation portal Babelzilla. Thanks a lot!

screenshots.caption: A birthday event generated by ThunderBirthDay according to a birthday set in the addressbook.
Notice the new ThunderBirthDay calendar in the list at the left.

addons.developerComments:
PLEASE review my code! Look at the readme.txt file in the XPI to see details about the development.

Developpers may want to increase verbosity by changing extensions.thunderbirthday.verbosity in the about:config dialog (0 means only exceptions are being reported, 5 means the error console is flooded with information).

addons.name: Get Partial Messages
addons.description: Get the rest of all partially downloaded messages from server.
addons.fullDescription: In the settings of Thunderbird you can choose to download only the headers of new messages or the part of messages not larger then a certain size. With this add-on an icon can be added to the toolbar with which you can download all partially downloaded messages in the currently selected folder.

screenshots.caption: New icon to download rest of partially downloaded messages

addons.name: Lightning Calendar Tabs
addons.description: Zobrazí záložky, pomocí kterých je možné rychle přepínat aktuální období v kalendáři Lightning. Všechny pohledy kalendáře jsou podporovány. Je možné upravit barvu textů záložek.
addons.fullDescription: Rychlé přepínání mezi časovými obdobími v kalendáři Lightning pomocí záložek. Záložky fungují ve všech pohledech kalendáře. Je možné nastavit barvu záložek pro budoucí, minulé a aktuální časová období.
addons.developerComments: This addon is based on my previous addon called Lightning month tabs.

addons.name: Quote Colors
addons.description: Quote Colors allows you to select text and background colors of different quote levels which are applied when reading or printing mail/news messages. Additionally, you can choose between graphical and traditional plain text quoting display mode.
addons.fullDescription:
Quote Colors is an add-on for Thunderbird and the mail & newsgroup client of SeaMonkey.

It allows you to assign text and background colors to different quote levels which are applied when reading or printing mail/news messages. Five quote levels can be configured with distinct colors.
You can choose between two quoting display modes: graphical quoting with colored bars around quoted paragraphs (default), and traditional plain text quoting where each quoted line starts with one or more ">" characters. In graphical quoting, the color, position and style of the bars is adjustable.

Additionally, this add-on enables you to set up some basic message display options such as text, background, link and signature colors.

screenshots.caption: Options dialog: Advanced and Message options

addons.developerComments:
_____________
Note for users of SeaMonkey 1.x:

A version compatible with SeaMonkey 1.x is available at the extension's homepage.

_____________
General notes:

This add-on works best when used in conjunction with plain text messages. However, colors can be applied to HTML messages, but the result depends on the actual message. You can toggle HTML message coloring in the advanced options.

Please note that Quote Colors does not apply colors to quotes in compose window, i.e. when replying to a message you will still see the default colors.

_____________
More information and support:

For further information on installation and usage of this extension please take a look at its homepage where you can find a small user guide and FAQs.
Send all your questions/feedback/bug reports to the mailing list or address them directly to me. Thanks a lot!

addons.name: GNotifier
addons.description: Add-on for Firefox and Thunderbird. Integrates Firefox's notifications with the OS's native notification system. It supports most Linux desktops and Windows 8.
addons.fullDescription:
This add-on makes notifications nicely fitted in to style of Linux distribution or Windows 8.1. Every time when Firefox is finished downloading, it opens up the ‘Downloads Complete’ pop-up window. GNotifier replaces these window with the native notification, depending on your OS.

In Linux environment, GNotifier entirely relies on libnotify library, so if libnotify is not present in your system, it will not work.

addons.name: Lightning Colors Reminder
addons.description: Let's show the calendar color on Lightning reminders!
addons.fullDescription: Let's show the calendar color on Lightning reminders!

addons.name: Enigmail
addons.description: OpenPGP message encryption and authentication for Thunderbird and SeaMonkey.
addons.fullDescription:
Enigmail adds OpenPGP message encryption and authentication to your email client. It features automatic encryption, decryption and integrated key management functionality. Enigmail requires GnuPG (www.gnupg.org) for the cryptographic functions. Note: GnuPG is not part of the installation.
The addon offered here supports Windows, Linux (32 and 64-bit) and Mac OS X. Versions for more platforms are available from the homepage.
addons.developerComments: The source code is available at http://www.enigmail.net/download/source.php

addons.name: TT DeepDark
addons.description:
Smooth dark theme for Thunderbird
• Beta version available here
addons.fullDescription:
"TT DeepDark" (inspired from my "FT DeepDark" for Firefox) is a theme which has been created to transform the look of Thunderbird for Windows users. It has been specially designed for Seven (with Aero Style enabled), but it can also be installed on other Windows versions and Linux (just be aware that some things may look different due to differences between platforms).
It is not officially available for MAC, but for those who would like to try it anyway on that platform, you can force download and install it and once the package downloaded on your computer, you can install it manually by clicking the "tools" button in the add-ons manager and then selecting "install an add-on from file...".
As FT DeepDark theme for Firefox, It contains no added functionalities, it's simply a full GUI aesthetic customization.

• VERSION 10.0.3 AVAILABLE HERE FOR DOWNLOAD

• WHAT TO DO WHEN FACING AN ISSUE WITH TT DEEPDARK THEME ?

1) before reporting it, first try to see if the issue is due to the theme itself. How ? Enable the default theme and check if the issue is still there. If not, enable again the DeepDark theme, but disable all other installed addons to check if the issue can be due to a conflict between addons.

2) If the issue is still there after disabling all other addons and if the default theme doesn t have that issue, try to download and install again the theme (check also if you have the latest version installed, maybe the bug you want to report has already been solved with the latest updates).

3) if after trying what metioned above the problem is linked with the use of DeepDark theme, please, send me an e-mail (there is a link on the add-ons page to contact me) rather than reporting the bug on the add-ons page. When sending an e-mail to report a bug, do not forget to tell me which operating system (Windows XP, 7, Vista, Linux, etc.) you are running on your computer, which version of Thunderbird and DeepDark theme you are using and if you have any operating system custom theme (it can also be a cause of the issue). Then, describe the most precisely you can the issue you are facing and, if possible, please, join a screenshot and/or a short video so I could see exactly how it looks (English is not my mother tongue as you can easily notice, so a picture can avoid the language problems). All that will help me to understand better what is the problem and to solve it quicker, if possible.
I can t promise you that I ll manage to fix every problems and also in short time, but I ll do my best for it. I m working on my themes during my free time so it can take a bit time before fixing the issues (you need also to be conscious that any updates need to be checked by Mozilla first, but if you want to have the updates a bit quicker you can follow me on Twitter and know immediately when a new version is available for download).
addons.eula: Free for non-commercial personal use. Copyright of all graphics elemets designed for this theme belongs to the AUTHOR. Before any modifications and/or distribution of this work, please contact me and read the license file included inside the theme package.

screenshots.caption: TT DeepDark on Win7 (mail content area background and font color can be set via Thunderbird "options" panel)
TT DeepDark on Win7 ("message compose" window)

addons.developerComments:
Special thanks to :

Axel G., Ken S., Ken B. and Ivana R.

addons.name: Color Transform
addons.description: Adapt page colors to your taste or need. Save your favorite color scheme for automatic coloration. Comes with 18 predefined themes and 24 basic transforms for hue, saturation, lightness and opacity. For Firefox 24.0 and newer.
addons.fullDescription:
Introduction

Color Transform enables you to adapt the colors of web pages to your taste or need.

The Color Transform toolbar panel contains 18 buttons for applying a predefined color transformation or 'theme' directly to the active page. The themes are designed so as to obtain readable and predictable results on the majority of web pages.

The Color Transform toolbar panel also provides 24 buttons for changing the hue, saturation, lightness and opacity (HSLA) of all page colors in the same way. These basic transforms may be used to compose a desired color transformation.

Usage

> To save the (cumulative) color transformation that was applied to the active page, click the top-left button in the panel.
> To toggle automatic coloration of all opened web pages, click the toolbar button.
> To apply a saved transform manually, double-click the toolbar button.

The panel contains four buttons that toggle the inclusion of background colors (fills and gradients), foreground colors (text and borders), background images (background-image elements) and foreground images (image and canvas elements).

Tips

> Check out my extension Colorific if you would like to use domain-specific settings or color spectrum previews.
> Dark content themes are best combined with dark scroll bars (see the New Scrollbars extension) and/or dark Firefox complete themes (like FT Deepdark).

Known issues

> Color transformation may sometimes be slow, which is usually due to large background images which are referred to in style sheets.
> Automatic coloration will not apply to style sheets that are modified after the initial load event. You may double-click the toolbar button to manually apply a color transformation.
> Moving image content to canvas backgrounds fails for pages saved as MHT archive, but does work in MAFF archives.
> Support for Thunderbird will be removed but might be restored once Thunderbird supports CustomizableUI.jsm. The last compatible version remains functional, but you need to prevent it from updating.
> This extension is affected by the following known bugs in Firefox: bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=700926, 776363, 902636, 958972, 968541.

Future

Donate now to enable me to realize the following improvements:

> Support for multi-process Firefox (initiated).
> Use of WebGL for faster color transformation (initiated).
> Prevention of the flashes of bright tab or page colors before automatic color transformation occurs.
> Solution for web pages that modify style sheets after the initial load event.
> Preview of the effect on typical web pages.
> Transforms in the RGBA/HSVA/HCLA domains.
> Colorization of the Firefox user interface.

screenshots.caption: An example of the 18 HSL transforms: lightness inversion.
An example of the 18 color schemes: yellow on green.

addons.developerComments: Color Transform works by transforming the color data in style sheets, inline styles and images. In case a page element is selected, the style sheets are left alone and inline styles are inserted for all element-related rules.

addons.name: Stylish
addons.description: Restyle the web with Stylish, a user styles manager. Stylish lets you easily install themes and skins for Google, Facebook, YouTube, Orkut, and many, many other sites. You can even customize Firefox and other programs themselves.
addons.fullDescription:
User styles are themes for web sites. User styles empower your browsing experience by letting you customize web sites. Take out irrelevant content, change colors, or completely redesign the entire site. You can even use user styles as themes on the interface of Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey themselves.

Stylish lets you easily manage user styles. Add, delete, enable, disable, and organize with a few clicks of a mouse, no code to edit, no obscure configuration to find. Stylish's companion website, userstyles.org, hosts tens of thousands of user styles made by other Stylish users that you can try.

For you technical types out there, think of it this way: Stylish and userstyles.org are to CSS as Greasemonkey and userscripts.org are to JavaScript.

screenshots.caption: The Stylish manage pane in Firefox Add-ons dialog

addons.name: Toggle Proxy
addons.description: Toggle Proxy adds a status bar/toolbar icon to toggle between two proxy settings which can be set in the preferences or toggle via a shortcut key (alt + x) if you don't use the add-on bar.
addons.fullDescription:
Toggle Proxy enables you to toggle between two proxies by left-clicking on the icon in the status-bar (or via the shortcut key ('alt + x' version 1.3)) or the toolbar icon (added in version 1.7 for Firefox), useful if you use different proxy settings at work and home. (e.g. auto=home, manual=university). The two proxies to toggle between can be selected via the preferences, availble via the add-on menu in the tools menu or right-clicking on the icon in the status bar.

Versrion 1.7 now includes a toolbar button for Firefox.

Version 1.5 now includes support for Thunderbird.
addons.developerComments:
23/11/2012 - Added a toolbar option after feedback from reviewers. Decided to include it thanks to some contributions towards the continued support/development of this add-on - thank you to all of you who have contributed.

    21/5/2011 - After reading the reviews I've recieved I'm am now in the process of trying to remember what I did nearly 2 years ago and add a shortcut key to the addon. 

    22/5/2011 - Adding the key wasn't too hard, hard bit now will be to add support so that it can be user specified. Once I've sorted that I'll update the addon.

    24/5/2011 - Harder than I thought to add support for a user specified key so have submitted version 1.2 with a dedicated shortcut key (alt + t) whilst I work on a user specified key.

    8/8/2011 - New version (1.4) now available. Fixed the French locale and added a Dutch locale.

    28/5/2011 - Didn't realise alt+t would cause a problem as a shortcut key on Windows (doesn't on OS-X), have modified it to alt+x, tested on OS-X and Windows with no problems seen. New version uploaded (1.3) for review - should be available in a couple of days hopefully

addons.name: Quick Locale Switcher
addons.description: Allows you to quickly switch to a different language (User Interface, Spell Checker Dictionary and Website content) in your Mozilla application.
addons.fullDescription:
Allows you to quickly change and apply a different locale related setting from the tools menu, the statusbar, or your Toolbar.
Features:
* Handy tool for all people involved with multilingual usage of Mozilla applications.
* Switches the Mozilla User Interface language (general.useragent.locale preference)
* Switches the accept_language preference, so complete websites will be translated. (if the http accept language header is supported, e.g. like Google does)
* Switches the Spell Checker Dictionary preference. (if supported by your Mozilla application)
* Remembers the dictionary and content locale for each site and automatically switches when you load that site. It also tries to detect the language of sites itself, and if found automatically switches to that language. In Thunderbird the automatic switching is based on e-mail addresses.
* Auto restarts the application in versions 1.4+ (only if needed)
* Includes country flag icons for 'all' countries by famfamfam.com.
* Displays the flag of the currently selected locale on your statusbar.
* Add 3 of your own custom defined locales.
* Select from a list of ~200 locales which locales should be visible in the menu.
* Select which settings you want to switch.
* Quickly switch back to the previously selected locale by pressing CTRL + SHIFT + Q.
* Available for Firefox 1.0 - 3.0, Thunderbird 1.0 - 2.0, NVU 1.0, Mozilla Suite 1.7, Seamonkey, Sunbird, Flock and Netscape
* Available in: en-US, nl-NL, fr-FR, it-IT, de-DE, es-ES, tr-TR, ko-KR, pl-PL, cs-CZ, bg-BG, pt-PT, sl-SI, zh-CN, sk-SK, ru-RU, fy-NL, zh-TW, pt-BR, da-DK, lt-LT, ja-JP-mac, gl-ES, sq-AL, he-IL, en-GB, fa-IR, km-KH, uk-UA, hr-HR, be-BY, ro-RO, es-AR, hu-HU, nb-NO, fi-FI, ca-AD, ar, ml-IN, wa-BE, is-IS, mk-MK

* Note! After adding the toolbar button (menu View/toolbars/Customize) you need to restart your Mozilla application before it actually works
addons.developerComments:
***NO Restart is required***
The restart of your Browser/Mail application is only required if you want to switch the user interface language. So not if you only need to switch the dictionary. You can choose what you want to switch in the settings window, by default it switches both the user interface and the spellchecker dictionary.
***NO Restart is required***

For detailed help and information, visit the forum

addons.name: FireTray
addons.description: A system tray extension for Linux and Windows, allowing to set up custom icon, hiding to tray instead of closing, display the number of unread messages in mailing applications, and other features ...
addons.fullDescription:
CAUTION: In Xubuntu and environments where both AppIndicators and EWMH icons are supported, please unset the with_appindicator preference for full functionality. Check this issue.
Features:

    for all applications:
        show/hide a single or all windows
        restore windows to their previous state, position, size
        restore each window to its original virtual desktop/workspace
        activate restored windows
        hide to tray on close
        hide to tray on minimize
        start minimized to tray
        show icon only when hidden to tray
        mouse scroll on tray icon shows/hides
        themable icons
        popup menu (show/hide indivisual windows, open new windows, quit)
        keyboard shortcuts
    for mail applications:
        display unread messages count in tray icon
        display biff in tray icon when new messages
        customizable tray icon for mail biff
        include/exclude mail accounts to/from messages count
        include/exclude folders types to/from messages count

addons.name: Lightning QR Code Add-on
addons.description: Integrate QR codes for calendar events into tooltips for easy transfer to mobile devices.
addons.fullDescription:
This add-on for the mozilla calendar project ("lightning") displays QR codes for events in the tooltips, which can be scanned and imported by a barcode scanner on your smartphone. Only essential data which can be imported by popular barcode scanners is used for QR code generation, the rest is stripped so that the event data fits within the QR code limits. Instead of utilizing a third-party web service and in this way risking the exposure of private data, the javascript qrcode library by Kazuhiko Arase is used (with some modifications).

Note: Not all available barcode scanners support the iCalendar standard correctly. If you experience troubles with time or date etc. not shown correctly, please try another scanner. This extension was tested on a Samsung Galaxy S2 using "barcode scanner" from http://code.google.com/p/zxing, and it was able to scan and recognize codes up to QR code version 30.

addons.name: Colorific.
addons.description: Colorize entire web pages manually or automatically. With 28 customizable themes that transform hue, saturation, lightness and opacity. For Firefox 28.0 and above. NEW: Copy themes and group color properties using drag-and-drop.
addons.fullDescription:
Introduction

Colorific can be used to colorize entire web pages with 28 customizable themes, which may be associated to web domains for automatic colorization. A few examples of applied themes are shown in the above Screenshots.

To switch automatic coloration of newly opened web pages on and off, click the Colorific toolbar button. To manually apply a theme to a page, double-click the toolbar button.

The Colorific toolbar button gives access to the theme editor panel. To see the result of a change to a theme, click the top-left button in the panel to reload the active page and to apply the selected theme to the original page colors.

Each theme may be associated to multiple web domains using the second button in the panel. To merely use these associations as a white list for automatic coloration with the selected theme, toggle the second option in the options box. To also use the stored theme number, toggle the third option.

Modifying themes

> Select one of the 28 predefined themes.
> Each theme may be customized by dragging and dropping 14 property icons into a variable number of color spectra, thus creating groups of properties which may be changed together.
> The property icons represent HTML elements (image and canvas) and CSS color properties (color, text-shadow, list-style-image, background-color, background-image, box-shadow, border-color-top/left/right/bottom, border-image and outline-color).
> Each color spectrum defines a transformation for the colors of the properties it contains. This transformation may be specified by dragging sliders for hue, saturation, lightness and opacity (HSLA).
> Each slider represents a linear range of the original values from 0% to 100% (red to red, black to white, gray to saturated, transparent to opaque), which may be transformed by dragging the two end points of the range.
> A single color may be selected using the color picker element, but for most properties, images in particular, a range of at least one of the HSL values needs to be chosen in order to retain some contrast.

For further explanation, see the tool tips on the elements in the panel.

Tips

> Check out my extension Color Transform in case you would like to make step-wise changes to page colors or individual elements.
> The latest versions allow themes to be copied as text by drag-and-drop. You are encouraged to share your own perfect theme in a review on this web site for the benefit of other users - and perhaps your design will make it to the presets!
> Be careful with the option for colorizing large images, because it can make pages load slowly - normally, leave it switched 'off'. The same is true for the image-to-canvas-backgrounds option - normally, leave it switched 'on'!
> Dark content themes are best combined with dark scroll bars (see the New Scrollbars extension) and/or dark Firefox complete themes (like FT Deepdark).

Known issues

> The page content may become visible before coloration is applied, which is annoying for dark themes. Please try the page load timer option in Colorific. A better solution is being worked on.
> Color transformation may sometimes be slow, which is usually due to large, mostly unused background images which are referred to in style sheets.
> The automatic color transformation does not apply to styles which are modified after the initial page load event. You may double-click the toolbar button to manually apply a selected theme.
> Moving image content to canvas backgrounds fails for pages saved as MHT archive, but does work in MAFF archives.
> Support for Thunderbird will be removed but might be restored once Thunderbird supports CustomizableUI.jsm. The last compatible version remains functional, but you need to prevent it from updating.
> This extension is affected by the following known bugs in Firefox: bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=700926, 776363, 902636, 958972, 968541.

Future

Please donate to enable me to realize the following improvements:

> Support for the upcoming multi-process Firefox (initiated).
> Use of WebGL for faster color transformation (initiated).
> Prevention of the flashes of bright tab or page colors before automatic color transformation occurs.
> Solution for web pages that modify style sheets after the initial load event.
> Preview of the effect on typical web pages.
> Transforms in the RGBA/HSVA/HCLA domains.
> Colorization of the Firefox user interface.

screenshots.caption: Toolbar panel with theme editor, general options and theme overview.

addons.developerComments: Colorific works by transforming the color data in style sheets, inline styles and images.

addons.name: ImportExportTools
addons.description: Adds some tools to import and export folders and messages

screenshots.caption: Menu from the context menu in folders panel
Window with the preferences of the extension

addons.name: Color Folders
addons.description: Color your Folder Treeview Icons!
addons.fullDescription:
Got loads of folders? Hard to quickly identify the folder you want to open? The Color Folders extension is for you.
As you see on the Lifehacker
http://lifehacker.com/color-folders-makes-organizing-mail-in-thunderbird-easy-1588150139

Source code is now available on GitHub. Pull Request welcome!
https://github.com/fisheater7/colorfolders/

Version 1.1 now works with TB 24 and onwards. Thanks so much for your support and patience.
Special thanks to Strim for providing the fix.
Thanks to AMO reviewers for the super swift review.

For TB 17 & older users:
Please download version 1.0 which is equivalent to version 1.1 apart from TB 17 & 24 difference.

In case Color Folders is not working on your Thunderbird
Color Folders actually is perfectly working on my TB 24 (Windows 7 64bit) and onwards (31.5.0 as of today).
If it is not working on your TB, please help me to find out what is going on by doing;
Open TB menu -> Tools -> Error Console (alternatively just press ctrl+shift+J).
Click "Filter" box on bottom left and type "colorfolders".
If any error/warning/message left displayed, please copy it and post it via Review form.

If you have Account Colors 6.10 installed, please try upgrading it to 6.11 or later.

Known issue:
- Minor cosmetic issues on Linux.

ToDo:
- More icons (thanks Kevin for the suggestion!).
- To support servers and special folders.

screenshots.caption:
Right click on a folder and choose a color in Color Folders menu.
Select multiple folders to change them at a time.

addons.developerComments:
Please let me know if this extention is working on your Linux or Mac OS (with OS variant, version & TB version).

New in v1.1:
- Fixed the incompatibility with TB 22.0 and onwards.
- Works with TB 22.0 and onwards.

New in v1.0:
- Localized to en-US, en-GB and ja-JP.
- Windows Vista & 7 now show Aero (vertical folder) icons.
- Support for RSS and NNTP folders.
- More colors (70 in total).
- Some cosmetic improvements.
- Some bug fixes.

New in v0.95:
- Context menu is now correctly disabled on servers and special folders (excl. virtual folders).
- Context menu is also disabled on NNTP and RSS folders as they do not change color.
- Folder color now immediately changes even on selected folders (i.e. the known issue has been solved).

addons.name: CuteButtons - Crystal SVG
addons.description: add icons to buttons/menus/anywhere (CuteMenus - Crystal SVG not required)
addons.fullDescription:
Expect this extension to die when Mozilla gets rid of support for XUL-based add-ons.
It'll still work fine on Pale Moon, and I'll keep it updated on here till Mozilla decides no more XUL add-ons on AMO.

After that keep an eye on http://choggi.org/misc/CuteButtonsCrystalSVG/ (I'll get around to re-adding the update code to it).





inspired by/uses code & icon set from CuteMenus - Crystal SVG (you don't need to have CuteMenus installed)
I don't have any formal association with CuteMenus (this is CuteButtons), yes I realise the name was a bad choice...


please read the Developer Comments before posting a review


if you have icons missing/wrong, or you want an extension added then please send me an email

addons.developerComments:
lot of css rules to apply, if you have a slower computer you may wish to try a smaller icon extension

this extension sticks icons all over firefox, you should expect your memory usage to increase
FF 31.0 Win7 x64 16GB (fresh firefox install):
with CB: Private Bytes:137MB Working Set:151MB
without CB: Private Bytes:123MB Working Set:139MB
Palemoon 25.2.1 x64 (and my profile; 35 addons)
with CB: Private Bytes:259MB Working Set:232MB
without CB: Private Bytes:241MB Working Set:212MB

for some languages I haven't been able to add translations, so the statusbar shows a red X icon (you can hide the statusbar icons in the options or add them yourself and send the translated file to me)

CuteButtons has a knack for messing with configuration options for other extensions (try disabling icons in cutebuttons config, and please let me know)

if you use the toolbar button to open the options dialog, it will save the width/height for when you open it from Addons Manager (which doesn't allow you to resize options dialog)

you can use the icons.css file on older unsupported versions of firefox with userchrome.css (you will need to find/replace all the references to the image file)
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/XPInstall
http://www.lmgtfy.com/?q=userchrome.css

missing menu icons under linux:
http://dafizilla.wordpress.com/2009/11/08/karmic-koala-hides-firefox-context-menuitems-icons/



if you've made an alternate mosaic.png and want it to be included then send it to CuteButtonsCrystalSVG@choggi.org
you'll either need to edit one of the mosaic*.png files with the icons you like, then email it to me
or this is the file I use to make the mosaic*.png files, you'll need a copy of gimp
http://choggi.org/misc/CuteButtonsCrystalSVG/mosaic.xcf

addons.name: Toggle Word Wrap
addons.description: Toggle word wrapping and PRE element wrapping in the message composition and HTML display windows, respectively.
addons.fullDescription:
In the message composition window of Thunderbird or Seamonkey, it comes in handy when inserting long text lines which should not get wrapped in the final message (such as log file entries, or diffs inserted into the message body). It only has an effect when using plain text mode for composition - this is a per-account setting which must be configured by disabling Composition & Addressing → Composition → Compose messages in HTML format.

Unchecking Enable Word Wrap in the Options menu (or pressing the keyboard shortcut) will temporarily turn off word wrapping for the current message - lines will take up the whole width of the composer window, and no line breaks will get added to the outgoing message (with the exception of "hard" line breaks inserted manually).

Checking Enable Word Wrap will enable word wrapping again and set it to the standard width (which is modifiable through the mailnews.wraplength preference in the Config Editor, the default is 72 characters).

In a browser window (Firefox or Seamonkey), checking Word Wrap Within <PRE> in the View menu will temporarily enable word wrapping for <pre> tags in the current document (by adding CSS rules to the head element). Unchecking the menu entry will revert the document to the previous state (no word wrapping).

To reach me by mail, use the address moztww velox ch (insert an at sign before and a dot after "velox" – sorry for the obfuscation).

screenshots.caption: Thunderbird menu entry for toggling word wrap
Firefox menu entry for toggling word wrap in PRE elements
Toggle Word Wrap in Thunderbird's Composer window, wrapping enabled (default)
Toggle Word Wrap in Thunderbird's Composer window, wrapping disabled

addons.name: Arabic language pack
addons.description: Arabic Thunderbird translation
addons.fullDescription: Arabic translation for Thunderbird 2.x branch. Read installation instructions here: http://www.khaledhosny.org/static/thunderbird.html.

addons.name: Lightning
addons.description: Organize your schedule and life's important events in a calendar that's fully integrated with your Thunderbird email. Manage multiple calendars, create your daily to do list, invite friends to events, and subscribe to public calendars.
addons.fullDescription:
Make Thunderbird or Seamonkey even more powerful with the fully integrated Lightning Calendar. Lightning allows you to organize your schedule, access remote calendars and much more. Try it today!

Read the latest news and get information about known issues first by subscribing to our blog or following @mozcalendar on twitter.

=====================================================
Lighting 3.3.3 for Thunderbird 31 is available here
=====================================================

Lightning also supports older versions of Thunderbird like 17 or 24, please see the complete version history for details.

screenshots.caption: Lightning in calendar mode - showing the week view
Lightning in calendar mode - showing the multiweek view and the today pane

addons.name: Remove Duplicate Messages (Alternate)
addons.description: Search and remove messages which are the same as other messages in your mail folders (referred to as duplicates or dupes).
addons.fullDescription:
Found a bug? Report it or write me. There's also a Seamonkey version.

The original 'Remove Duplicate Messages' is missing important features, and does not have a free software license. This is a full rewrite, with an GPL-LGPL-MPL license. Performance has been improved and many features and capabilities have been added, including:

- Choice of comparison criteria (subject, author, date, etc).
- Comparison of message bodies.
- Action on multiple folders.
- Review dialog for double-checking which duplicates to delete and which to keep.
- Good performance on local folders with large number of messages; reasonable performance with IMAP and RSS accounts.
- Spiffy toolbar button+menu.
addons.developerComments:
I had tried contacting the author of the original 'Remove Duplicate Messages' several times, without success. I would have liked to join forces and have just one extension, but that doesn't seem to work out.

Also, some locales are incomplete - help with them would be appreciated. Visit the BabelZilla translation website.

addons.name: LightningButton
addons.description: Toolbar-Buttons for Lightning; advances the feature to get rid of the tabbar.
addons.fullDescription:
Adds toolbar-buttons: Calendar, Tasks, New Event, New Task, Convert to Event, Convert to Task, Messages

Features:

    Adds Toolbar buttons
    Hides Calendar and Tasks Button in tab bar
    Hides Tabbar on Calendar and Tasks tab, if Messages button and Calendar/Tasks button is visible.

Requires:

    Lightning


Have a look at the Developer's comments section below if you need help on using the Add-on.

If you want the toolbar back on the top, you can install an add-on moving it for you. If not, you can also add the toolbar buttons on the menu bar.

Warning: Do only use the feature to hide the tabbar when having the icons on a always-visible position, like the menubar or the main toolbar with Rise of the Tools.

screenshots.caption:
The Toolbar Buttons (left to right):
Messages, Calendar, New Event, Convert to Event, Tasks, New Task, Convert to Task

addons.developerComments:
Go get the buttons, do the following:

    Right-click the toolbar
    Choose Customize...
    Search the button(s)
    Drag it to the place on the toolbar you want it
    Close the customize-window


If you don't want the tab bar buttons to be hidden, go to the advanced-tab in the preference window (Tools|Options).
Navigate to the General sub-tab and choose Config Editor (button).
If you see a page with the warning message, This might void your warranty!, click the button labeled "I'll be careful, I promise!", to continue.
Enter extensions.LightningButton.hideTabButton., you will see two items in the list:
extensions.LightningButton.hideTabButton.Calendar If it is enabled, the Calendar-Button will be hidden.
extensions.LightningButton.hideTabButton.Tasks If it is enabled, the Tasks-Button will be hidden.
You can change the values by double-clicking on it (Windows).
